I loved the spaghetti and meatballs (called extra long noodles on the menu, I think) as well as the caramel/vanilla soft serve gelato. The spaghetti was a perfect al dente. I'll definitely be back for the spaghetti. I particularly enjoyed my red wine (montepulciano) too. I found the wine selection to be really easy since there's a set menu ($10/glass). 

Note that the service model here isn't conventional. In my experience, I ordered everything at the counter and paid, and tipped all before seating. It seems like once a space opens up (if there's a wait), then I got to pick where to sit. After ordering, I was given a pager. Utensils and napkins are at the table already. And water is self serve, I believe, which I totally missed. There's still nice staff that brought food to the table and answered questions during last call. 

I'll be back! I enjoyed the food here.
author: Alias A.

description:
TL;DR: small portions and long wait, for alright pasta... a good option for doordash or Postmates.

Food (2/5): portion size was pretty small for the pastas. I would pay more for a larger bowl of pasta. Didn't order a plate, but definitely felt like it would be more food and more filling 
- Bucatini with clams: just awful. It was too sour for my taste. And half of the clam shells were just empty shells taking up space. Maybe they do their pastas in bulk? Either way, definitely DO NOT get this dish. 
- Spaghetti and Meatballs: pretty good. Sauce was amazing, pasta was done well, meatballs were kind of dry. Really wished the portion size was bigger. Seriously not enough. 

Service (3.5/5): the place was way too busy. We didn't even see a waiter near our seat in the back corner. Couldn't get a glass of water. But the receptionist is was very nice.... he dealt with hangry customers on the waitlist with kindness.

Atmosphere (4/5): crowded...  but pleasantly intimate. You can hear the person next to you.. petty good place for a date.

Wait time: the receptionist said "10-40 minutes" and we waited for 23 minutes. 

Tips: order to go if you live near by. If you are on a date definitely get a plate and a pasta or a plate and 2 pastas if you don't want to leave hungry.
author: Helen K.

description:
Obviously came here after the Buzzfeed Worth It Pasta episode. 

Solid glass of Cabernet franc for $10 and the my most favorite and delicious Extra Long Noodles which is your traditional plate of spaghetti and meatballs! 
Drooling now.

Pasta cooked perfectly al dente, the sauce at the perfect setting.  Please , eat here !!! And ship me some to Costa Mesa . 

Cheers
author: Brusselz B.

description:
My friend and I were craving carbs, and decided to check out Barzotto's fresh made pastas.  The location was super convenient, just a couple of blocks from 24th & Mission BART. 
 We arrived for an early Tuesday dinner (~ 6pm), and there was no line to order and plenty of open seating.  And, once we ordered, the food came pretty quickly as it was ready.

We ordered the Radiators prepared "cacio e pepe" aka fancy white cheddar mac and cheese style, and Pappardelle with slow braised beef, mushrooms, and parm.  Both more than adequately satisfied our carbs cravings.  The Pappardelle was truly outstanding with generous chunks of braised beef.  I am already trying to figure out when I can go again to get more!

We also ordered the Porchetta to share.  It was rich and flavorful with crispy edges, accompanied with some pickled veggies and house salsa on the side.  So good, but it was overkill since we got large orders of both pastas.

My friend had a daily brew Pilsner, and I got a glass of the Prosecco, which was a healthy pour of light and refreshing with just a hint of sweet.

This added up to be a $90 meal (with 20% tip).  A bit pricey for a place without table service, but worth it given the high qualify eats and healthy pours.
author: Christina L.

description:
The service was friendly and the pasta came out fast, but it wasn't hot, it was room temperature. It came with egg on top of the pasta, but it was super runny and undercooked -- the white was still translucent. Maybe if the pasta was hotter it could have helped to cook the egg a bit. 

I'd give the place another shot, but I don't think I'd get the carbonara again.
author: Laurie L.

description:
On Sunday, at the tail end of brunchtime, the sidewalk tables were all occupied but not a single soul sat inside. There, two tables were pushed together to give the three of us & our large order more space to spread out. 

We ordered: 
-- focaccia starter with a tangy marinara. Not a lot of flavor in the bread. 
-- two kinds of pasta: "snail shells" with marinara, ricotta, lemon zest, & pepper; and "radiators" which is radiatore with mushroom ragu, breadcrumbs, & parm. I thought the latter had a surprisingly strong mushroom flavor given that the ragu had a watery consistency. Overall, the sauces didn't grab onto to the pasta. We added chicken to both, which came as shredded rotisserie chicken; would have liked heartier chunks of chicken breast. 
-- porchetta board: I didn't try but my lovely ladies enjoyed it, especially smeared with the accompanying cherry mostarda. 
The portions weren't overwhelming, but neither were the prices. 

With several eateries in the neighborhood offering similarly jazzed-up casual Italian fare, competition is stiff. Barzotto will have to make a few improvements if they hope to steal my business away from those more established joints.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Ok I'm giving it 5 stars. Came in for my first time and had the spaghetti. It was unreal, but who is gonna give 5 stars to an Italian spot just cause it has good spaghetti.

So I came back. Got the parpadelle... And the snail shell pasta... with a side of the pickles.  I'm blown away.

The pasta is so well prepared. Perfect texture. The flavours of both are so traditional. The parp with braised beef is perfect... nice and dark flavour but melts in your mouth. maybe only Thing better would be rabbit. The lemon flavour of the snail shell pasta dish, just such a nice summery touch.

Best pasta spot in the city. Im coming here again and again.
author: Devon W.

description: Been meaning to try this place for over a year. Disappointed that they only had 1 white sauce pasta option. The focaccia was meh. I'll give it another shot. The pasta was beautifully plated though.
author: Kimberly J.

description: I love this place. By far, my favorite spot for Italian food so far. One thing I really like about this place is that it gives you serving sizes that are appropriate. Some places just give you so much fun and it isn't very tasty. Better than any other place in the Marina. Also, service was really good. They were like done getting our food in like 5-10 minutes and the meat dish, 15 minutes. And they felt like they were late so they offered us a free serving of ice cream. I recommend getting the porcetta, the meat melts in your mouth. My favorite Italian spot in SF. Worth it, the tv show finally got a recommendation I really liked.
author: Kuan H.

description: Barzotto has been such a find! Italian food, especially pasta, is my absolutely favorite. Barzotto has a really great ambience going on, with an open kitchen where you can see pasta being rolled. Their menu is limited, which I really like, because what's on there is spectacular. I'm vegetarian, and there are quite a few options. There's a cauliflower pasta, a marinara pasta and the stuffed tubes. My favorite is the marinara and stuffed tubes, although all three are pretty fantastic. The focaccia is not great, but you could get the veggie platter as a starter. The staff are not super friendly but since you basically order and pay upfront before being seated, there's not much interaction with the serving staff. Don't forget to get the housemade soft serve gelato! The one with honey and sea salt is to die for.
author: Sharadha R.

description:
Perfect date or group dinner spot! 

You order up front, so you can avoid the awkward fight to pay for the bill or split the bill in some mathematical way so the person didn't drink or ate less can pay less (you know what I'm talking about). 

A bottle of wine is $40. A glass is $10. You get 6 pours with the bottle. So worth it. The California blend was an excellent choice. 

The menu is small - yay! 
Pasta recommendations - Spaghetti with meatballs, cockscomb, snail shells, ribbons. All so so good. Basically the entire menu. 
Roasted half chicken was juicy and flavorful. 

Great experience, fun vibe, delicious food. Can't wait to be back!
author: Dana Z.

description:
Like some of the reviewers here, the Buzzfeed "Worth It" Series brought me here. Me and my friend were excited to try out this place.

I came a while back with my friend on a Sunday night for dinner. We did not make a reservation and was expecting a long wait. But it turns out, the restaurant wasn't too busy so we got a seat shortly after we ordered. It is an quick dinning type of concept. Order at the counter, get a tracker, and the waitress will seat you at a table. The menu consists of pasta, appetizers, and dessert.  We ordered a salad to shared and each a pasta to try. My friend got the spaghetti and meatballs and I got the clams pasta. The salad was served first. The salad was bland and dry with little dressing. I noticed the lettuce pieces were turning red, a sign that it is not fresh. I had a taste of the spaghetti and meat balls, it was good but not amazing. The pasta with clam was.... bad. The flavor was bland and worse of all there was sand in my pasta. Most of the clams shells were closed, which usually is a sign that it is not fresh. 

I don't know what happened. Maybe it was just a off day for Barzotto but I can not justifying paying more than $15 for dishes that are not fresh and has sand in it. I looked through yelp reviews after and noticed that many other who ordered the clam pasta has sand in it too. Barzotto is definitely not my "Worth It" pick for the price and quality.
author: Sunny L.

description: Delicious food they deliver to your table. Feels farm fresh. Portions small but just right. I had the ribbons and it was so yummy
author: Wallace W.

description:
Would not recommend this spot, the food and service does not make for a great experience. 

I ordered the carbonara and in the menu it read egg, it may be my mistake that I didn't ask how the egg was cooked but I did specifically ask if there was anything raw in the dish. The cashier said no (this is a counter spot where they give you a number and you sit down). When I god my plate there was a raw yolk on it. I was pregnant and asked if there was a way to cook it or just not have it. The staff seemed pretty irritated that I asked for a change but considering my situation I wasn't going to risk it. Our table got an ugly look from the cook behind the counter and she proceeded to angrily take the yolk off and send it right back. I would've appreciated a substitution or at least a better reaction to my request.

The carbonara was very plain and the extreme saltiness of the pancetta did not compliment the other flavors. The focaccia was good and the latte was also decent. 

There are much better places in the Mission to eat.
author: Viviana M.

description:
Barzotto is like the Souvla of Italian. 

You order at the counter, and they bring you your food. It's a pretty nice place but still has that ~cool casual~ vibe. There is a lot of variety in pasta; my favorite is the pappardelle, but the quality is all a-ok. I don't really think it's worth the $13+ price point, but it's a cute spot for a second date or something within that social hierarchy.
author: Denise L.

description:
Came here on a weekend afternoon -- husband and I both ordered pasta dishes in large sizes and he had a beer.  The beer came in a pretty tiny cup and the pasta serving size was quite small for the price.  

Overall the experience warranted only 3 stars.  For the price, the serving sizes were relatively small compared to other quick Italian pasta spots in the city (e.g. Italian homemade company).
author: Siv L.

description: Cutest little place! Ordered the spaghetti with marinara & meatballs and it was delicious. The dish was so flavorful but not too rich, and the noodles tasted SO FRESH and homemade! The ambiance of the place is cute, modern and casual. A little pricy but for the quality of the food I would definitely go back.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Let's preface this review by saying I love pasta. Like I exclusively ate pasta as a little girl and my mom would call me her pasta girl, saying I was entirely made up of pasta, which wasn't a huge lie. So, I have pretty high standards when it comes to pasta and prior to going to Barzotto, I didn't think a place could come even close to Il Corvo in Seattle in serving ridiculously good pasta eats. 

Upon walking in, I was a bit surprised to see how casual it is in here! You order at the counter and get a number and then seat yourself - I honestly love that! It removes the sort of stodginess you get with being seated and all that jazz. 

We decided to split the Cockscomb (cauliflower, chili, almond, and cresta pasta), and the Ribbons (braised beef, mushrooms, and pappardelle pasta) and then sat ourself at the bar counter so we could see the chefs making the fresh pastas, which was so fun to watch! 

The food came out and it was GORGEOUS! I just knew this was gonna be some superbly good pasta! I took a bite of the beautiful green Cockscomb and WOW what an explosion of flavor. This one is super lemony with a nice minimal bite from the chili and some crunchiness from the almonds, and cooked perfectly al dente. I then tried to Ribbon - another home run success! The papardelle was so fresh and tasty and the sauce was creamy and indulgent, with the braised beef just pairing perfectly. Wowza. I knew I had finally found a place I could compare to Il Corvo!

Go here and have yourself a good time and some good pasta!
author: Sabina S.

description: Lively place for pasta. Try the spaghetti and meatballs with extra noodles. The porchetta is also pretty great--crispy on the outside and tender in the center. Neat spot near the 24th & Mission St BART station. Mission Dolores Park is a short walk away, making it a nice spot for dinner and a stroll.
author: Johnny M.

description: First time to Barzotto , I came with my boyfriend he ordered ribbons based on recommendation from employee and I order extra long noodles spaghetti. The taste of both plates was amazing its a must try! Im definitely coming back and exploring more of the menu
author: Michelle C.

description:
Came to Barzotto for a low key date night. It has a very cute small casual vibe. Not an upscale Italian restaurant but they serve quality food. 

Would not recommend this place for a large group as the tables are all pretty small. We requested to sit at the bar area where you can watch them make the pasta from scratch. Talk about fresh! Felt like I was back in Italy watching them. 

If they offered pasta making classes, I would totally sign up! Haha 

Anyways back to the food. I ordered the Porchetta board and my boyfriend ordered the slow braised beef pasta. 

The Porchetta board was yummy but did not fill me up. As neither did my boyfriends pasta for him. We ended up ordering the cracked pepper pasta after as we were still hungry...we have appetites. 

Overall the food was delicious and I will definitely be back and recommend it to others looking for quality Italian food in this part of SF.
author: Lauren P.

description: Went here for a late brunch on Sunday. Ordered a chicken pasta carbonara. Water is self serve. Just grab a carafe near the front counter. I love how you can see your food being made since the kitchen is near the seating area and is open. Love the pasta. Tasted great with the chicken, soft egg, and chunky bits of bacon. Just gotta say that they had a hella good music vibe going (Common - The Light is pretty good easy listening for this typing of dining environment when I was there.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
*** In Short ***

Another okay Mission eatery, albeit with lackluster pasta options.

*** In Depth ***

Honestly, I'm not really sure Barzotto is a place I'd personally go back to. That's not to say the food is bad, but if we're talking purely about pastas, there are much, much better options in the city, like Corridor and a Mano. I think I'd even prefer Pazzia and Caffe Macaroni over their pasta, actually.

But, the saving grace here is their porchetta, which is kind of fantastic, and well worth trying. So, let's split the difference here and give them 3 stars, with the caveat that you're better off getting pasta elsewhere.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A bit on the tighter side, but still pretty accessible, both in terms of getting around and seating.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: Place was clean and had above average serivce. The food was fast after ordering and it was fresh with good flavor. But it felt short in a sense. Like something was missing.
author: Xavier M.

description: Saw the spaghetti on the Buzzfeed Worth It show and decided to give Barzotto a try! The portion, and flavor was spot on! The concept is similar to Souvla where you pay first and sit down. I would recommend for a casual lunch or quick dinner!
author: Ally C.

description: Came here because the buzzfeed video. They made this place look delicious. Who ever took our order was RUDE AS HELL!! We were super rushed and he didn't let us really look at the menu, damn I was parched & wanted some wine but I got water instead because he literally was rushing and it wasn't busy at the time. The spaghetti was pretty good I liked the freshness, but uhm the service... SHEEEEESHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH CHILL we tipped and everything he's so mean
author: Cwiddy B.

description:
Our group came here after the line at Beretta was over an hour long. We were in the mood for italian and not in the mood to wait.

We walked by and saw there was no line at all here, and there were actually empty tables. Should this have been a red flag? I don't know.

We ordered the:
 - Ribbons (Pappardelle- slow braised beef, mushrooms, parmesan)
 - Radiators (Cacio e Pepe - cheese and pepper)
 - Snail Shells (Lumache - marinara, ricotta, lemon zest, pepper)
 - Roasted Half Chicken
 - House Made Foccacia
 - Side of Pork Meatballs
 - Bottle of brut rose
 
My favorite items were the ribbons, foccacia, and the pork meatballs. The ribbons and pork meatballs had a good flavor, and the bread was very moist and was perfect to dip in all the sauces. None of these really blew my mind, but they were the better ones in the bunch. 

The snail shells are okay, and so was the half chicken. Chicken was not dry; it was, in fact, very moist, but just it was just a well-made rotisserie chicken, which is pretty basic. I liked the pickled veggies that came with the chicken. We actually didn't plan on ordering the chicken, but only did because the porchetta was sold out.

My least favorite item was the cacio e pepe. This item was also not planned to be ordered, but we were told that we didn't have enough food for our group of 4. The cacio e pepe was rather bland. I've had homemade cacio e pepe prepared by a non italian that was better than this.

All in all, I still had a fine experience because I was with good company, the service was fine, and the food was decent. It wasn't so good that I would come back though, because there are probably better options out there.
author: Jacqueline V.

description: i'd come back to barzotto in a heartbeat!  really convenient ordering, delicious pastas that are served quickly, open seating, warm and inviting space. i came in with my girlfriend on a monday evening and the place was jammin'!  we order the spaghetti with meatballs, ribbons, and side of beets. i thought the pastas were tremendous and very reasonably priced. my gf didnt love the beets, and i thought it was a bit pricey as a side. we also got a soft serve each with salted caramel and the cherry/pistachio toppings - also pretty good. note that it's just vanilla soft serve with toppings.  i'd be down to try some of their plates, including chicken and their porchetta, which was prepared in front of our bar seating and looked amazing. overall, positive experience at barzotto and i would come back for solo dining!
author: Christina L.

description:
I am so happy I found this place! 

First, the Lambrusco is amazing! I have never had a sparkling red wine before and now I had to go hunt it down at several places in San Francisco to bring home. Now I feel like a Lambrusco hoarder. 

The pastas here are great. My favorite is the ribbons. The braised beef on it will melt in your mouth, and you get a nice hearty helping of carbs. The carbonara was delicious also. I have been back several times and I have gotten those 3 items every time and left very happy, so maybe I will get something new the next time I come in.
author: Nikita K.

description: I was in the mood for some Alfredo pasta, so I decide to try this place.  BARZOTTO does not have Alfredo, but they do have a white sauce pasta.  I ordered the Stuffed tubes Cannelloni which has roasted mushrooms, kale, and bechamel breadcrumbs.  I always love tomatoes on my pastas because I love the fresh taste, so I asked for some fresh tomatoes and some Parmesan cheese to be sprinkled to the top of mine.  For myself, I paid a total of $16 and gave a tip of $2 so plan on spending a good $50 for two.
author: Carolina G.

description: The spaghetti & meatballs was fucking delicious. Looks like a simple dish, but was packed with flavor. Those extra long noodles were cooked perfectly. I'd go back to this place solely for this dish.
author: Charissa S.

description:
Came here (like almost everyone else) after seeing Buzzfeed's worth it video, and wanted to try their spaghetti. You order first right when you walk in and then seat yourself afterwards. 

Since I'm a vegetarian, I noticed that there wasn't a plain marinara spaghetti option on the menu so I asked the cashier and apparently not having meatballs with it wasn't an option. I was shocked! I love spaghetti and the sole purpose of the visit was to try theirs! Luckily, after explaining this, the sweet cashier helped me out and made it happen for me. I appreciated the extra effort of service. So why the 3 stars?

The place was surprisingly dirty. Many of the forks in the basket had left over pasta sauce stuck on them. The plates that the server brought down had pasta sauce stains on them, and even after seeing this, the server still gave them to us. I had to wipe everything clean myself.

Their beet appetizer looked beautiful with dollops of whipped ricotta, but they were so watery and had no taste. We suspect they were old canned beats because they seriously only tasted like cold water. No seasoning nada. 

Now for the spaghetti, the sauce was smooth and creamy and the spaghetti had a beautiful bite to them. But after 5 forkfuls, it was all gone! For $13 the portion was small. Especially if compared to the shell pasta dish which was significantly larger.
author: Gwendolyn F.

description:
A new go to spot for me with one request to put the carbonara on the dinner menu!

Food: 4.5/5
Service: 4.5/5
Ambiance: 5/5

The extended review...

Brunch food:

Mixed green salad - a very refreshing salad given the citrus.  Portion size was pretty good as well.

Egg sandwich - this was a very basic dish.  Not a bad dish but I enjoyed the salad and pasta much more.

Carbonara - as Joey says..."WHOAAAA".  This dish was awesome!  Pasta was cooked to perfection.  My only gripe is that they only serve this for brunch.  I think it should be on the dinner menu as well.

Dinner food:

Campanelli - another good pasta dish that I enjoyed.  The pasta once again cooked perfectly and filled with meat and peas.  Can't say no to this dish.

Service:  friendly and attentive staff.  

Ambiance: very casual and a order and seat yourself kind of place.  Decor is very modern and rustic and has a lot of good detail to it.
author: Spencer Q.

description: There is nothing "Italian" about the food at this place, other than its served on pasta.  First customers walk in, and are stopped at the door to place an order, like it's a fast food restaurant, before you can be seated.  Second, they don't serve iced tea, which should be a big strike against any place, because some of us want something to drink that is not filled with sugar.  Third, the timing of food being served was bad ... they brought out one dish for my dining partner, while I had to sit there just watching him eat (I insisted he start so his food didn't get cold while waiting for mine), then was practically finished before they brought out my dish.  Then only after both of these past dishes were served did they think to bring out the appetizer dish that we specifically asked be served first.  All the servers do is hand you a bowl, and run off, and for this bad service, they expect a tip.  Really?!  But forth, and worse yet, the food was nothing like expected, weird taste, and nothing Italian about it.  I definitely will not be going back to this place.
author: Chris A.

description: This place is just okay. It first was hyped up and brought to my attention on Buzzfeed Worth It, so I really wanted to give it a try. The process of ordering and service is a bit odd, but not necessarily bad. We got the spaghetti dish and the "snail shell" dish. Both of which tasted pretty good, but I felt they were overpriced given the portions and quality. The visual presentation of them is pretty good, though. It didn't taste bad but nothing to get super pumped about. I'm definitely glad I went to try it for myself given my curiosity, but probably won't be coming back.
author: Jade V.

description: Service is deplorable. Menu seemed basic. Didn't bother to eat there, since I don't want to spend money at a place where the servers can't even muster basic courtesy. If you're going to gentrify the area, at least do it with a smile. Wish I could give it 0 stars.
author: Cat B.

description:
Been here twice and so far so good! Tried different  pastas each time. So I really like the extra long noodles and ribbons. My husband tried Bells and we both didn't like the mint too much on the pasta.

The pasta is cooked perfectly with a slight chew. Everything is made fresh.

The second time I brought my 2YO by myself. He ate quietly the entire time. The tables were perfect height for him to shovel pasta into his mouth 

Might be a regular here.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I love Barzotto! I've come here many times and their pasta is always top notch. They seem to rotate the sauce and switch up even the ordering style sometimes, but that's part of what I love. Each time they seem to be trying to improve their dining experience and add something new.  I love everything from the atmosphere - they're a rustic modern pasta bar practically hidden between a gas station and a bakery on a highly populated street - to the really professional staff - once 3 of us were apologetically asked to move to a smaller table to make space and were offered a full free bottle of wine as compensation - to the amazing pasta. Seriously, these dishes are so filling and the pasta is perfect every time. I will say, some of their sauces are really different, so if you're not sure what the menu is saying, ask the servers. I've had a few friends expecting just a plain old red tomato sauce and be really surprised when their dish looks more like a pasta salad or cream based soup!
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
Came here on a Friday afternoon with a friend for lunch after wanting to come here ever since watching Buzzfeed's Worth It like most other reviews here.

I won't go over the process as it's been stated many times already. I ordered the spaghetti & meatballs and my friend got the ribbons with braised beef. My friend also got a glass of wine that I couldn't remember the name of.

The decor of the place is great, bonus points for using a lot of natural lighting. I feel like the decor alone would bring me back to this place.

My friend's entree came first before mine did which is a little off-putting but I didn't mind it terribly but I can understand if others are more bothered by it.

My spaghetti was done perfectly; al dente with the perfect amount of bite. Meatballs were soft and not too dense; I could cut it in half with my fork with relative ease. The sauce had the perfect amount of acidity with a kick to it to keep things interesting.

My friend's entree was terrific and honestly, I liked his more than mine. The sauce was rich and decadent and paired with the braised beef added another level of juicy deliciousness.

Even though my friend got two glasses of wine, he did mention that it was only okay whereas their beer selection is good.

All in all, service was great, my only gripe being that our entrees didn't come together at the same time. My friend said that his entree was superb and that is high praise coming from him. We will most definitely come back. I highly recommend this place unless you're looking for a place with waitstaff and table service.
author: Richard C.

description:
My friend and I are always trying new places in the city. We've had our eye on this place for some time and decided to go the other day. It was well worth our hour bus ride. 
We both ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, it comes out in a small bowl which you would think is not worth it. It's actually very filling. 
I honestly liked the way they seat you. You walk in place your order at the counter and then they go and seat you. It's a pretty small place so I wouldn't go with a group larger then 4. Overall it was a great meal. If I was in the area I would go back, but I wouldn't go all the way to the mission just for this.
author: Veronica V.

description: The Spaghetti and Focaccia bread were the highlights. The spaghetti was perfectly al dente and the meatballs were made with some fragrant herbs. Honestly one of the better spaghetti I've had at any restaurant, as it's clear that Barzotto staff take their dishes very seriously. Every bite was delicious and fun to eat. The focaccia bread was equally amazing, with each bite being warm, soft, and savory.
author: David Y.

description: Amazing pastas that were fresh made. We got the bells and vegetable platter to share. Super filling, but light.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Good but not spectacular. Spaghetti was very heavy (I think a lot of cheese). Beef pappardelle was good but oily. The best was the ricotta lemon zest lumache (snail shells) - this was pretty unique and good. Would probably go back for the snail shells but not the other two.
author: J D.

description:
4* for ambiance. It's casual, trendy and perfect for an easy date night or dinner with friends. 
You order at the counter and get a number. 

3* for the food. We ordered the mixed salad and the little gem salad. The portions are a good size. The mixed green salad was tasty - excellent combination of flavors with cara cara oranges, olives and pickled red onions tossed in a champagne vinaigrette. The little gem salad had plenty of flavors that just didn't come together quite right! 

Onto pastas:
Radiators - tasted like buttery cheese sauce with black pepper...for $13. 
Bucatini - very stingy on the squash. Bucatini was unevenly cooked with some over cooked but also, many undercooked.
Snail shells - not memorable 
Long ribbons - if you're keen on getting pappardelle with slow cooked beef, barzotto's version won't hit the spot - go to NOPA.

Overall, 3*. Not a memorable meal. Probably not likely to return even though I live 3 blocks away.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I've heard a lot about this place and I really wanted to like it.

So my wife and I came in with our 2 young kids tonight - A Sunday night. It was pretty busy so before we ordered, the front desk woman worked with us to make sure we'd have a good place to sit with our kids + stroller. We found a spot in the back, and they asked the table next to us if it was OK to have the stroller, and they emphatically said yes. Then we went to sit down and a server came by and said we couldn't sit there because there needs to be enough room for everyone. Which, fine, if those are your rules we're happy to play by them. But you should have consistent rules, and a system where one person is responsible for seating. And if any servers disagree with how guests are sitting, they take it up with the person responsible -- NOT the guests. Anyway, this was a stressful + contentious start to our $91 meal.

The food had highlights and lowlights:
- Beets: Super highlight. Absolutely delicious. And for $6, actually quite a large portion. Probably the highlight of the meal. Definitely get the beets!!
- Porchetta: Pretty tasty! At $20 maybe it's a bit pricey for what's more or less an appetizer-style course. But the presentation was baller, the cherry mostarda was delightful + there was a smear of jam too that was quite nice.
- "Bells" campanella pasta: The pasta was over-cooked, the cauliflower was mush, there was no acidity to make it pop. I feel like this could be a good dish but the execution was not good. It was a chore to eat half of it.
- Baby lettuces: This was a bad salad. The lettuces were definitely not "baby", the leaves took several bites each. And the leaves were watery. And there was basically no dressing. My wife claims she tasted some but I didn't notice it.
- Wine: Cab franc + Chardonnay. These were OK.
- Snail shells pasta: Complimentary given the mixup with the seating! Well actually they messed up someone else's order and so they said we could have it or they were throwing it out. This was actually pretty great. It was the same ricotta as the beets but the pasta was properly cooked, the tomato sauce was on point, there was some nice acidity -- this is definitely a keeper.

Overall, for $91, I'm not sure that we gained anything by going to a counter-order place vs. a traditional restaurant. Traditional restaurants know how to make guests feel at home with seating, and you'd get the benefit of food coming out in courses. They're just a lot less stressful + often less crowded. And for pretty much the same price.

One counter-order pasta place that was absolutely killer was The Italian Homemade Company up in the Marina. Similar concept but more Italian and better executed. Also "a Mano" and Perbacco have just insanely good pasta. I think we'll go back those places a few more times and probably skip Barzotto. But Barzotto was worth a try.
author: Jon E.

description: Lord save me this is the best pasta I've ever eaten. This pasta brought me to heaven. This pasta transformed my life. I am a changed woman. I came to this country twice in one week, and both times I had to come here. So good we had to get another bowl to split and another each to go. They offered us free wine for the wait. We are over the moon. Ariel at the front desk helped us. It was her first day at the front and she was amazing and so helpful. This is my favourite restaurant in the world.
author: Ellie D.

description: Friendly service, that went above and beyond, great food, lively atmosphere, with a cool layout and unique format that really works for the Mission District (and truly anywhere with a fun crowd)... Highly recommend!!
author: Bennett L.

description:
My salad was ok. The dressing had a strange spice. 
But this review is about the beets.
The beets
Omg, the beets.
They were out of this world!
author: beth m.

description:
Oh. My. God. This is my favorite pasta place in the city. Where do I even begin my praise of this perfect pasta heaven? 

The aesthetic of this place is an Instagram influencer's dream: white walls and white tiles, nice lighting, mirrors on the walls, high top and regular seating with light wood finishes...you catch my drift. You walk in and are immediately greeted with a mini market - yep, they make all of their pastas in-house, and sell them among a variety of sauces, oils, and wine. My friend and I decided to take a seat at the bar, which gave us a front-row seat to the pasta-making action - needless to say, we were enthralled. 

I ordered the "Radiators" (Radiatore) which was their take on carbonara (pictured below). I added the pancetta and while I'm used to it being a bit smaller in size, the meat was excellent quality and added an interesting texture to the dish. I don't know what it was about it - the freshness of the pasta, the gooey-ness of the egg mixed with the load of parmesan cheese (idk if they dropped the can by mistake or they just blessed me with a generous portion), or the crispness of the pepper - but this was the concoction of every pasta lover's DREAM. Food porn indeed. 

My friend and I ordered water this time, but best believe I'll be getting wine next time - passed by a man who ordered a glass and it looked like quite a healthy pour ;)
author: LoMo P.

description: Super yummy dishes. Quick service and taste amazing. Love that we're sitting infront of the prepping table.. kids friendly tooo
author: Jennie C.

description:
They brought a chef in form Flour + Water, which makes the spaghetti awesome. 

You would have to pay for it first before sitting down. Make sure you get the dessert coz they're amazing. 

Insider tip: they have a weekly "Gnocchi Night" every tuesday from 5:30-10pm in which they will have different special gnocchi off-menu. Also another fun one is the large punch cocktail, during brunch hours. They're like $45 up to 5 people.
author: Kevin L.

description: This place is AMAZING! The food is delicious, and the service and staff go above and beyond! Truly a great place to grab dinner. Bonnie and Amelia are great!! They made the dinner experience all that much more unique, fun and special!
author: Kiana S.

description:
We arrived on a Saturday around 6pm and the restaurant was relatively empty.

We went in and were greeted by the front cashier after he helped other customers. He explained the menu and told us the process of finding a table and then coming back to order when we were ready. Water is also self served, but it was quite slow so they were nice enough to bring it to the table.

We ordered the half roasted chicken and porchetta boards. Both were really good. The chicken was juicy and the prochetta had some good cuts too. A few slices were inconsistent but we still gobbled them down. We weren't a big fan of the pickled veggies though.

We will try the pasta next time!
author: Michael T.

description:
Barzotto really impressed me, maybe because I was not quite sure what to expect when I walked in for lunch several weeks ago.  There's a mixed casual/sit-down vibe to the place, since you order at the front though you can definitely eat your food in-house.  While there was nothing that made me think the food would be subpar, I did wonder if the less formal dining setting would negatively impact the quality. 

Luckily, my friend and I were able to sample a selection of their menu, and I thought all the dishes were great.  My favorite was their porchetta, which came with a delightfully crispy exterior covering succulent and well-flavored pork.  Even though I'm not the biggest mushroom fan, their version of pappardelle with a beef and mushroom sauce was al dente and quite tasty.  Given how full I felt by the end of the meal, I do not think they were stingy with the portions; I'm already strategizing a way to get back to try more of their menu!
author: Keith H.

description:
Pretty perfect mid-week lunch date spot!

Arrived on a Thursday around noon and my friend was already waiting with a lovely glass of Rosé (which I tasted and liked a lot!). Space is really beautiful, light-filled, and bright with nice colorful pops of color. High ceilings, bar seating with stools and some low tables along a padded bench.

They don't take reservations but we were able to get a table for two easily for lunch. Ordering is at the front and the menu is small but focused. Once you order, they give you a number for your table and food is brought to you. Service here was refreshingly unfussy even though the food is nicer fare. Kudos to the staff for creating a friendly and down to earth vibe!

Food was great! Absolutely no misses and we ordered a variety of things to share.

Focaccia-buttery and really tasty even without the marinara sauce. Great for sopping up the sauce from the pasta we ordered.

Kale and cabbage salad-besides being very pretty to look at, it hit all the notes of a great salad. Nicely dressed and a variety of textures. Definitely not boring and something I'd love to try to recreate at home.

Roasted chicken- very impressive spread! Chicken was tasty (slightly pink in one piece unfortunately). The accompaniments were the star of the board--loved the olives, mustard, and eggplant (?) spread it came with.

Cockscomb Pasta- we rounded out the table with a pasta dish because we knew Barzotto is known for their fresh pasta. This was a pretty simple dish but I really liked the sauce (focaccia was perfect for soaking it up) and the cauliflower in it. 

Really enjoyed everything about this dining experience! Will be back for sure and definitely would like to try their dinner service.

** As with all restaurants in the gentrifying Mission, I hope the owners train and hire black and brown people from the neighborhood. I hope to see people of color in the FRONT of the house as well as in the kitchen, I hope people of color at Barzotto have opportunities to pursue leadership and management positions in the restaurant, I hope leftover food is donated to local pantries or shelters, etc. etc.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Totally underrated Italian restaurant in the Mission. Solid 4 stars FASHO. Order at the front, get a buzzer, find a table and the food comes to you! We were there on a Friday night around 7, and didn't need to wait for a table.

PAPPARDELLE SLOW BRAISED BEEF, MUSHROOMS, ROSEMARY 5* was my absolute favorite. Before I came in, I did my Yelp research and knew this was what I wanted to order. It did not disappoint. It was perfection. Creamy, meaty, flavorful, perfect pappardelle pasta.

RADIATORE WITH NDUJA, BROCCOLINI, BURRATA 3.75* - it was solid. The pasta itself was great and allowed for the robust tomato sauce to creep into the pasta crevices. Burrata was fresh and generous. Wasn't particularly a fan of the nduja, but ohwell. 

FARMER'S MARKET VEGGIES 3.5* is a platter of market veggies mostly roasted. There was a mix of brussels, squash, carrots, etc and a side of pickled veggies as well. It was plated beautifully, but the flavors were nothing special and I would have expected the portion size to be a bit larger considering this is an "entree".

PORK MEATBALLS 4* - juicy, moist meatballs with that yummy, flavorful tomato sauce

The menu changes often- my friend that came once before said all the pastas were different than when she came the last 2 times. The pasta here is amazing and there's also a selection of freshly made pastas that you can pick up to make at home. For this price in SF, this is probably the best you can get.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The farzolleti pasta and porchetta board are just as expected, totally delicious!! 4 stars for the food. But wait, you have to pay for bread that really should have come with the porchetta? I don't know about that. 

Now let's get to the business aspects which sadly I am giving a 3-stars...Firstly, not a big fan of the pay upfront approach for the price and the establishment. It almost makes it feel like a fast food joint but it isn't. It also doesn't make business sense because my friend and I totally would have ordered another round of drinks or some other stuff but we definitely were too lazy to get back in line to make additional orders for more food and drinks that we clearly didn't need but felt compelled to get in the moment after the first drink. So they def. missed out on more business with this pay arrangement. Secondly, the added stress of finding seats, sitting down, then walking over and standing in line to make orders, then back to your seats walking your drinks, etc...really makes you start second guessing about the price and tip you are paying for the whole experience...

The lukewarm service didn't help either. The lady at the register was pretty cold. Then the bus boy literally just snatched the plates right off in front of my friend the second she put down her fork and walked off never even making eye contact with either of us. As a former waitress my friend was somewhat dismayed. 

I'd definitely go back for the food. Decent pasta that's reasonably priced is strangely hard to come by in the Mission. I'll probably have to drag a different friend though...
author: Xiu L.

description: I was looking forward to trying this because of Buzzfeed. My husband had the famous spaghetti and I had the Bucatini. I enjoyed my dish. It had clams, they weren't over cooked or rubbery, done just right. The pasta had a light sauce and the portion was just right. My husband's spaghetti was just OK, nothing we would order again. It just didn't have enough robust flavor. It was too light on taste for our pallets. The one dish we really enjoyed was the focaccia bread. It was definitely the highlight.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
The city isn't a place you visit much if you don't live there. The parking is bad, traffic is rough and most places are overpriced and not maintained.

As tempting as it is to eat at the cooperative pizza place next door, this place has a charm of it's own. 

You can order family style or on your own, but either way you order first then they bring your food to the table.

Salads and pastas are solid here. They definitely shoot for quality over quantity so with that being said either eat something ahead of time or get ready to spend.

Entrees are in the $15+ range and the menu changes a bit between lunch and dinner. For me it was more about the people I was meeting there, but the food definitely kept me interested.
author: Scott A.

description: Trendy, modern casual Italian .. mouth watering dishes.. we sat at the bar next to the kitchen and saw the exec chef in action. She is also on buzzfeed. Highly recommend.
author: Rajiv C.

description:
I feel it over price and little food not going back
Not great size portion of foods to eat for food lover
author: Angela S.

description: Came here after watching the Worth it video from buzzfeed and was sadly disappointed. At 6:45pm on a Friday the place was packed and we were initially told the wait was going to be 1hr to 1hr 30, but we were luckily seated in 40 minutes. Was really looking forward to the spaghetti and meatballs from the video but it turned out just okay. Best dish was the ribbons pasta with beef!!! However the food is not worth the long wait.
author: Karina T.

description: Had take out from this place, we ordered Pork Meatballs with Marinara, Rotisserie Chicken, Horseradish Mustard, Gluten Free Strozzapreti with Tomato Sauce, Lumache with Marinara & Ricotta, Cresta di Gallo with Roasted Cauliflower and Roasted Sweet Potatoes. I had high hopes for their meatballs, and they were definitely mediocre. Honestly, I thought the food was just Meh.
author: Jie L.

description:
Love this place! I really like the Cresta de Gallo, French toast, and foccacia bread. My boyfriend also really enjoyed the eggs Benedict which came with sides of crisp potatoes and refreshing salad. The Cresta de Gallo has the unique cock's comb pasta which I love the texture and subtle spinach flavor of.  Their orange juice was delightfully fresh and delicious. Not a fan of the nitro coffee but I'm also not a fan of cold brew.

This place has a hip and modern feel to the place with traditional Italian touches. I like the open kitchen seating. The place seems small but can fit a lot of people. It has a cozy intimate feel but open air space.
author: Jacqui C.

description:
I don't know, I guess because it was on Worth it and all 3 of the guys picked Barzotto as their Worth it winner, I expected to be amazed. I think even if I didn't go in with high expectations I wouldn't have been satisfied. The spaghetti was too sweet and the meatballs were just meh, pretty bland. The water was warm, although I'm pretty sure we could have asked for ice. 
The wait time wasn't bad in my opinion, the place is pretty small so 45 minutes for a table for 4 is reasonable. I didn't like that although you were going to dine in, you had to pay for the food before you got seated just because you had to choose how much of a tip you wanted to leave. What if the service was nothing to rave about or what about if it was great? And I already decided what tip percentage to go with? The service was just okay, by the way, she brought us our food and then came once around to ask if everything we had ordered already came out, after we said yes, she didn't come by again. 
Anyways, what I'm trying to say is, I don't think I would come back.
author: Laura A.

description:
Another great Italian option in the mission we had a 3pm feast after a nice short walk from Dolores park. You pay upfront then grab your seats and enjoy. It is all white marble and tall tables so it feels airy and inviting. We ordered

Little gem salad: the pickles made this dish, the crunch and acidity they offered pairs well with the cream dressing, radishes and sesame seeds

Little shells pasta: none of us enjoyed this one. First the shells are the color and shape of warm larvae, but it had either a cumin or curry flavor to it and was extremely salt. It just didn't work with the flavors. All three of us have diverse preferences and agreed this was a total miss. 

Ribbons: has to be homemade pappardelle, it was so velvety perfect like a ribbon. The braised beef was perfect, the Rosemary was subtle, and mushrooms melted together just great. 

Pork meatballs: sauce here was classic and satisfying when you want that traditional Rustic Italian sauce and the meatballs were hearty and just the right ratio of fat to lean meat.

Porchetta: see picture. Both a hit and a miss. The inner portion of pork was quite dry and should have just been removed.While the outer ring was impeccable and to top it off there was a crispy ring of fat that so perfectly crunched in your mouth. The greenery underneath was a nice touch as well as the jam and pickled veggies. We didn't too much care for the other dipping sauce.
author: Morgan S.

description:
We ordered dinner from here via UberEat. The amount of pasta was extremely small - almost like a child's meal with food just in the bottom of the dish. We ordered "large" for the beef pappardelle. But I don't think this comes close to matching the description of "large".  Even for regular, the size was too small.

I guess they figure that for people that can't complain in the restaurant, they can just do whatever they feel like.
author: Ying C.

description: One of the best italian places in san francisco. Their spaghetti and meatballs are very delicious and their porchetta.
author: Ki Yong K.

description: I stopped by here before a movie at the Alamo and had what is likely the best pasta I've ever had. Every bite was wonderful and it was very quick service in a great atmosphere! Quite affordable for dinner with n the city. Outstanding!
author: Alfred D.

description: Simple. Fresh. Homemade. Barzotto nails the classics! Their version of Cacio e Pepe is perfection. If you need a little more sustenance, the slow braised beef with pappardelle will suffice. Feels casual yet more than suitable for a laid back date night. Don't come expecting Buca di Beppo family style portions despite the prices. But you can expect quality.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Its a order at the counter and they bring it out to you type of place so keep that in mind.

With that being said, it's still very delicious. We ordered 2 pasta dishes, one porchetta board and focaccia bread all for 60 + tip. The porchetta board was definitely a standout
author: Genica R.

description: Wine was good, portions were small, but the one star is because the pierced noodles gave my boyfriend and me food poisoning
author: Evelyn L.

description:
Went to this 'pasta bar' last night for dinner with some friends. We had a variety of dishes.
The food quality was good, but I wouldn't give it 4/5 stars because of the price of the food.

You order at the front and the food gets brought out to you. Loved the hipster decor of the place. 

For the Pasta dishes, we had the Cockscomb, Grills, and the Ribbons. All pretty tasty. Pasta was a little on the soft side (I like my pasta more al dente), but the flavors were good. Not huge portions, but decent side. My negative: Not sure if they were worth $14, $15, and $16 though. With that kind of money, you can get a good pasta dish at a really legit Italian restaurant, you know, the places with well dressed waiters and tables with table cloths.

For the Main dishes, we got the Half Chicken and the Porchetta. Again, not bad, but not amazing for the price - $16 (chicken) and $17 (pork). You would also want to get some of the sides to accompany the dish. 

Decent place to go and enjoy a glass of wine and have some overpriced food in the Mission. It's still a nice place to have good conversation with friends over a good meal.
author: Cicely T.

description:
This place was awesome! We had a great meal of pasta with friendly service. I had the little queens pasta and it was delicious. Great sauce and portion. The atmosphere was fairly casual which was nice. 

As we finished our meal the manager (I think he was the manager?) Asked us very kindly if he could relocate us to make room, and offered us a free bottle of wine. How nice! Will definitely come back.
author: Nick M.

description:
Excellent value dinner spot. Came here right when they opened for dinner service. Really enjoyed the fast casual dining experience. Food is ordered up front and delivered to your table.

Had the beet appetizer, market garden vegetable entree and beef pasta. Everything was delicious. I could probably skip the beet dish but I think this was because the market  veggies blew it out of the water. The two of us shared everything and is was incredible.

If by yourself or one more I would recommend sitting at the bar overlooking the pasta area.
author: Andrew K.

description: Ugh, I love Italian esp pasta and long as it's flavorful and made well I don't care if it's $5 or $50 . Like most I'd agree the prices at Barzotto are more than what you get.  The portions are fine but the taste really lacks. My tomato ricotta pasta was so bland even a hefty amount of crushed red pepper flakes couldn't fix it. However, I did enjoy the Kale salad. I ordered delivery so I haven't actually gone in and may give it another chance, as it wasn't that terrible! I just again wish it had more flavor . I think it's nice the menu is simple so it's makes choosing fairly easy!
author: Hetal P.

description: WORTH it?! It was definitely WORTH it. Restaurants are super expensive in SF, especially Italian ones. This one was different, everything was made from scratch and tasted amazing. Whichever pasta option you choose it'll taste great no matter what. The pasta was al dente which was a huge plus because some places cook the pasta too soft or too hard...this was just right. I'll definitely stop by again when I'm in the Bay Area.
author: Chris K.

description:
16.09.18     1st time ... 

Food ------------------------ 4.5 shallow, only had 1 dish
Service --------------------- 3.5 Simple ... not a linen table service joint

This is a shallow review ... one dish ... a good one too

The one I had was either ...
     tube paste filled and flatten at the ends and twisted 
or
     square sheet filled in the middle then
     rolled to form a tube then
     flatten at the ends and twisted

Result ...  individually wrapped Tootsie Roll .... giggle giggle ...
author: S.K. Y.

description:
This is my go to Italian place in Mission after work. The food is reasonably priced and offers good selection of wines that doesn't break your bank. 

I have had their Snail Shell, Radiators, and Bells pasta - a very decent variety of vegetarian dishes. 
Snail shell - very classic marinara sauce pasta with ricotta. If you wanna do sth plain simple, this is great.
Radiators - has a slightly thicker sauce with a nice change in texture by the breadcrumbs. 
Bells - you need to ask them to make this vegetarian. It comes with broccoli mixed with pasta, very nice if you want some vegetables in your dish 

For appetizers, I like getting their salad to share as well, but found their focaccia with marinara sauce uninteresting. 

The wait isn't crazy on the times I've been there. All in all, a solid place to satisfy your pasta craving on a weekday.
author: Yu-Hsin L.

description:
Hands Down Amazing! 

I first went to Barzotto for an office lunch. My coworker saw the restaurant featured in an SF-themed blog and fell in love with the beautiful decor and food. 

Now my office is hooked! We are a landscape and architecture firm, so we value design and high quality--both characteristics Barzotto encapsulates. The freshly made pasta is unique and flavorful--the range of which would give your Nonna a run for her money. 

My boss loves this restaurant and goes there to entertain clients. It's definitely our go-to spot. 

Recently, another coworker of mine ordered a late night office dinner from Barzotto using the Yelp Eat24 app. After 30 mins, I went to the restaurant to pick up the food, only to find out that they no longer accept Yelp Eat24. The man at the register, who I'm assuming was the owner, apologized profusely. He put a rush order on our food and even gave us two extra entrees. Super nice! As if that weren't enough, after receiving the food, they threw in a $50 bottle of red wine. Now that is what I call customer service! This made me love Barzotto even more than I did before. 

Lastly, oh yeah, as for food suggestions, I highly recommend the Parpadelle (best pasta dish of the house), Cresta di Gallo, roast chicken, pumpkin ravioli seasonal special, and the spumoni soft serve gelato. Craving the gelato as I write.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Janice C and I have been wanting to dine at Barzotto since it opened.  We finally arranged a catch up dinner last Thursday on a rainy night.  I arrived at 5:40 to secure a table and was surprised that the actual normal height tables in the back were already all taken.  Doesn't anyone work normal hours in SF?  Granted, there were only 3-4 tables but still.  The rest of the seating is a few high top two seaters by the door otherwise it's all communal or small chef's "counter" seating.  

Ordering is all done at the cashier counter than you get a number tag where the staff bring you your food.  We ordered to share the pappardelle, the cock's comb pasta, and the porchetta.  

The hunk of porchetta was served to us quickly.  It had more fat than I'd like but the meat was moist and the skin was crispy.  Much appreciated that they had some pickled veggies alongside, and the condiment sauce was a nice touch.  Janice's nose detected some fish sauce.  We always love porchetta and this one was a winner.  Next up was the pappardelle.  I always love this thick noodle!  They were cooked al dente and served with a braised beef ragu and rosemary mushroom sauce which wasn't overly heavy, but oh so comforting.  Last up was cock's comb pasta.  This one was light served with cauliflower, olive oil, garlic, almond, chili flakes and lemon.  Definitely for those wanting something healthier.  I was wanting more from this dish, but it was solid.  

Barzotto calls itself an American pasta bar, so don't expect traditional Italian fare here.  The menu is straightforward with about 6 pasta dishes, two salad options, three plates, and gelato options for dessert.  I just wish there was more comfy seating options.  I was very happy to see hooks under the tall tables though.  I'll be back for more pasta and porchetta!
author: Cat C.

description: I just went on a bumble date here and think it's the cutest place for a first date. We sat at the pasta bar where you can watch the chefs make pasta right in front of you. I got the mushroom pasta and loved it- I want to go back and try all of the other dishes!
author: Zoe T.

description: Every bite is superb, that's what gets five stars. The place is noisy. People noise, not music. There is a line out the door. Daniel wore many hats. He seated me, took my order and took dishes off the table. He says everybody who works there follows the same example. Can't imagine anybody doing it better than Daniel. I am blind, he had to read the pasta menu. I had pasta with beef, mushrooms, and Parmesan. The sauce made the dish. The meal was supplemented by a glass of house Cab which tasted like it had some age to it. The place was recommended by a volunteer at the Marsh Theatre, a block away. The highest recommendation, "I'm going back soon."
author: D.E. N.

description:
Visited on a Sunday night at 6pm.  The restaurant was mostly empty except for two tables.  Apparently you have to order and pay for all your food and drinks first at the counter - like a fast food place - and then find a table.  This alone is enough to not want me to hurry back.  

The menu is very small.  5 pastas.  2 salads.  No appetizers.  A few sides and a couple of boards.  Small wine list - wines are $10 a glass.  Ordered 2 glasses of wine, vegetable board, side of focaccia, snail shell pasta and the Bells pasta.  About $75 without tip.  

Food came out pretty quick.  Loved the vegetable board.  Pasta was good to above average.  

May get take out in future but BARZOTTO will not be on my list if I am looking for a full dining experience.
author: Marty M.

description: After watching worth It,  I decided to try this place.  I am a bit disappointed because I love spaghetti.  Tried spaghetti with meatballs and it tasted okay nothing special about it.  I would go there again and try there clam pasta.  I give them another chance
author: Greg V.

description: It's little gem in the Valencia neighborhood. Chic and nice atmosphere. Super fast service. Can't go wrong with their pasta choices.Highly recommend the beets and the buffalo soft serve gelato!
author: Z A.

description:
Giving this place 5 stars all the way because handmade pastas are always the best!!! I also really love the concept at Barzotto! It felt like fast-casual dining! Order your food & drinks at the counter, choose a place to sit, and everything is brought to you! My husband and I found a cozy spot up at their counter which had a window looking into the kitchen and it was fun seeing the delicious pasta dishes being made!

Barzotto offers wine by the glass & bottle BUT you can also bring in our own bottle of wine for a $15 corkage fee which is what we did. We started off with their housemade focaccia bread which was crunchy and buttery and so so good! Their cabbage & kale salad was one of the best salads I've ever had. And we shared the cavatelli and cresta di gallo pastas. The first thing I noticed when eating the pastas was that you can tell they are fresh and homemade! The ingredients they use in the dishes were creative and combined really well together! Everything had great flavor and was so delicious! We cleared every plate that we ordered! The food also came out very fast! Staff was very upbeat and friendly. The vibe in the restaurant felt trendy and energetic. Absolutely loved this place and thought the concept was brilliant! Cannot wait to come back!
author: Chisholm T.

description:
Fresh pasta in a relaxing, no frills joint in the Mission? Barzotto. A solid 4 stars for sure. 

Order at the register, they'll give what looks like a buzzer, and you seat yourself. The device that looks like a buzzer will not actually buzz. It actually tracks where you seat yourself so they can figure out where to bring your food. Kinda neat. 

I had the pierced spaghetti (bucatini) with pancetta, tomato, chili and breadcrumbs. The sauce was quite delicious and I felt the pasta could've been a bit more al dente but was still good. Usually when having pasta, I get incredibly sleepy with carb overload but I still felt light after eating here. 

Also shared the turkey meatballs with my gf. DO NOT PASS THESE UP! They're juicy and tender but the sauce is amazing!!!!!! I actually preferred the meatball sauce over the sauce in my pasta dish. 

Definitely coming back so I can try their roasted chicken and porchetta,
author: Susy C.

description:
Mama told me when I was young
"Come sit beside me, my only son
And listen closely to what I say
And if you do this it'll help you some sunny day"

Be a simple kind of man.

Barzotto can help you with this, or serve your simplicity if you've already perfected.  

It's long and narrow, a shotgun restaurant, as it were.  Straightforward happiness greets you at the door and will ask you to describe what you'd like to have for supper.  Fortunately, the menu is simple and as such the transaction in the beginning takes but a moment and isn't rushed or confusing even for me.  If you arrive at a normal dining hour and not the hour of ba where you get to steal all the sweet and low before the others arrive you'll have a few minutes waiting for the greeting and so as have time to peruse the selections.

I say skip lunch and go ba, for as it's always more pleasant this way. But that's just me.  Do what you want.

A pasta dish, a salad, and the pork served on a simple wooden board with pickled things.  The kitchen is right over there and the people that bring you what they make are prompt and happy you're in their house.

This isn't maybe a full on date night place.  It's a place to take that person with whom you're already acquainted to enjoy good food thoughtfully prepared served promptly and in and out and on your way you are.  If you'd prefer to tarry with your other there are places for that.

The simple things in life.  i hope you give this place a try ...
author: Markus N.

description: Love the fresh pasta made at barzotto. When we are feeling lazy, we order through Über eats. ALL the pastas are delicious (yes, we've tried them all) the snail shells with egg is our absolute favorite! And the roasted beets with ricotta is our go to appetizer.
author: Erinn P.

description: I sat at the bar and had a nice view of the chef's prepping all the fresh pasta right in front of me, free entertainment! The pasta looked great I enjoy the fact that they make their pasta in house. I had to get the spaghetti and meatballs after watching some snapchat competition. This place won unanimously on the show and in my heart. I could smell the meatballs being cooked before I got my food, it was great. Would recommend to a friend.
author: Chase R.

description:
I don't mean to be a hater. I really wanted to love Barzotto, but I found it to just be middle-of-the-road good. If we lived super close by, this might be a place I would pick up food from. But it didn't wow enough for me to go out of my way for. 

This fast casual place means you order up at the bar but they bring food to your table and help clear tables which is a weird concept for a place that tries to toe the line between somewhat upscale. The prices certainly didn't reflect the lack of inclusion of service, and I rather have paid a bit more for a better experience.

We started off with the beets and the pickled vegetables. We love a good pickled veg (I mean, hello Mission Cheese shop), but these were nothing to write home about. Beets were tasty and a good amount for the price. The snail shells were tasty but simple -- with lemon zest, ricotta and marinara sauce coating each shell. However, I was fairly disappointed by the braised beef over pappardelle. The ribbon noodles were too al dente (chewy much) and the whole dish lacked seasoning. 

I expected more, but found this place lacking. Sorry, but I rather hit up A Mano for delicious affordable pasta.
author: Vic C.

description:
I love Barzotto.

I love all of the pastas, the atmosphere, the gelato, the wallpaper in the restroom, the hard-working dishwasher (team of 1!). I like how you order up front and seat yourself (good since it eliminates the need for your party to split the bill).

My most favorite pasta would have to be the Ribbons-- braised beef pappardelle. I've also had the snails (snail-shaped pasta with marinara sauce, and dollops of cheese). The gelato is creamy and flavorful.

The water is self-serve or by request.
author: Alison H.

description: Decided to try this place after a friend of mine heard about it. I got the snail shell pasta and it was amazing! Never had anything like it! The focaccia bread was good but they dont give you much. This place is super tiny and crowded so expect to wait a bit. It is pretty pricy as well. You can order before you get seated which makes things faster. The service is very good. Id love to try other pastas in the future!
author: Auriyon J.

description: Amazing pasta that was quickly served as well. Went there on a Friday night and was seated immediately. Get the bread as well! The gelato was not the best however, the main courses are definitely more worth it. Really great customer service!
author: Maya P.

description:
Wow. There is nothing like a good pappardelle, which is hard to come by I guess. The slowly braised meat, creamy sauce, topped on top of freshly made in-house pappardelle is a match made in heaven. The prices are not too bad, and despite being a new restaurant on trendy Valencia St, the place lacks the pretentiousness of other recent additions to my neighborhood. Get the pappardelle, or fast all day and get the porchetta. 

Treat yourself. Get here.
author: Anthony G.

description:
This restaurant raises the bar...zotto! 

My friend raved about this place so she decided to take me here for dinner. Verdict? My friend definitely has good taste. 

Ambiance is casual and modern - perfect for a date or catch up. You order up front at the counter and then you find your own table (or before it gets crowded, have a friend find a table while you order). 

They have a simple and solid menu. They offer salad, pasta, boards (i.e. porchetta, veggies, roasted half chicken), sides (i.e. meatballs, breadsticks, giardiniera), and vanilla gelato sundaes! They also have a wine and beer selection. In the back of the restaurant, you can see the chefs freshly make the pasta. Service is friendly, attentive, and quick. 

My friend and I shared the Turkey Meatballs ($8) which are two HUGE meatballs covered in marinara. I thought the meatballs were just okay. 

I ordered the Fazzoletti Pasta ($17) which is handkerchief pasta, slow braised beef, mushrooms, and rosemary. The pasta was soft and incredibly tasty and the braised beef was tender. All of the ingredients mixed well together to make such a delicious dish. The portion size was perfect. I didn't feel hungry afterward nor did I have that heavy stuffed feeling I sometimes get from pasta. I was very impressed! 

My friend ordered the Bucatini Pasta ($15) which is pierced spaghetti, pancetta, tomato, chili, and breadcrumbs. It was just as tasty (although I still prefer the Fazzoletti Pasta), the spaghetti was chewy, and the breadcrumbs definitely added that extra UMPH texture. 

I'm glad I got to check this cute Italian restaurant. I would definitely come back and try their other food items.
author: Kristal D.

description:
I'm conflicted about this place. The pasta is delicious, but I don't really get their fast-food approach. Considering how much you end up paying for a dinner, it's kind of weird that you have to stand up to order. I wouldn't mind it if it were more affordable, but the way it is it seems just confusing to me. 

But yeah, the pasta is good!
author: Marta F.

description:
I'm the female equivalent of this: http://bit.ly/2bx04DS. 
 
If I could be a stay-at-home furmom, I would. But those containers of organic, free range raw dog food and microbubble baths can't pay for themselves so alas, I must work. 

On the weekends, I try to bring Tater Tot everywhere I can (he's the social butterfly). I was following Barzotto on FB and saw they had outdoor seating. It's just a tiny lone table outside but it's better than nothing so decided to pop in for lunch before going to the dog park.

Barzotto opened last Wednesday and took over the St. Vincent space (next door to Arizmendi Bakery). It's a fast-casual restaurant - order at the counter, you receive a buzzer, grab a pitcher of water, and sit yourself. 

The menu is pasta centric with 5 pastas, 2 salads, roasted chicken, porchetta, 3 sides, and soft serve vanilla gelato. Everything is under $17, and gluten-free pasta is available for +$3. Wine, beer, and low proof cocktails only.  

When ordering with the cashier, I told them we would be dining here and sitting outside with my dog. I was told the table outside is for "take-out only" and that our food would have to be served in to-go boxes. I was pretty annoyed because how do you expect customers to share and slice a hunk of meat in a to-go box? 

Anyhow, maybe it was a miscommunication (since they're so new) or maybe they decided to change their policy because our food was served on actual plates. Thank you but that whole situation was awkward.

For lunch, we shared the Porchetta Board and the Bucatini. The slice of Porchetta ($16) was beautifully presented on a wooden board and adorned with accoutrements: frisee, pickled veggies, a berry jam, charred lemon, and a chimichurri: http://bit.ly/2bwPj77. I was a bit concerned with the mixed reviews of the porchetta but ours came out fine since we came early in the day. The skin was crackly: http://bit.ly/2bJz187 and the meat was tender. It was on the bland side but I didn't mind since the chimichurri and squeeze of lemon gave it good flavor. You can take a slice of the porchetta home for $10 (in the cold case out front). 

We were going to order a salad to share but I remember reading that the chef came from Flour + Water and they have awesome pasta so we also ordered the Bucatini: Pierced spaghetti, pancetta, tomato, chili, breadcrumbs ($15): http://bit.ly/2busooq. I'm glad we did because the pasta was solid. The housemade pasta was perfectly al-dente with a great toothsome chew and the tomato sauce was robust and tangy. The pancetta was rich and fatty but not overly salty. The chili added nice heat while the breadcrumbs added great texture. 

For drinks, my friend ordered the Nitro Coffee ($5): http://bit.ly/2bfNWGD. I gave up caffeine but had a sip and it was super smooth and not bitter. It was easy to drink without cream or sugar. 

Staff was nice and food arrived timely. Even though I was given a buzzer, one of the employees said, they'll deliver our food to us. Everything else is self-service.

The space is much more contemporary than its St. Vincent days and they've installed pretty black and white deco tiled floors. There's counter seating where you can oversee the chefs making the pasta which is cool. 

Street parking was surprisingly easy to find since we got there before noon but good luck at night. It's easily accessible from Bart (one block away). 

Barzotto is such an improvement over its predecessor that served terrible, overpriced food...which Bauer gave 3 glowing stars to (good bathroom reading: http://www.modernluxury.com/san-francisco/story/the-trouble-the-michaels). 

Why is that man still relevant after a century?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: We had the best pasta here ! Super cute restaurant .I had the snail shells and it was delicious ! Also the meatballs are a must for a side order. The manager Ruy was excellent! He was awesome , Super nice and welcoming . We came for the pasta but will be back for the service . Definitely a great place for a date night . Also the gelato with sea salt and local was amazing !!! Super creamy !
author: Ayla S.

description:
I eat Barzotto a LOT, so I thought it was time I left them a review!

Their food is excellent.  Period.  I order delivery from them quite frequently on Uber Eats, and it always arrives quickly and is piping hot / delicious.  The pasta sizes are a bit small via delivery - they don't have small / large options like in the restaurant, but everything is always great.  I tend to order the Cockscomb pasta a lot for delivery, along with the little gem salad and the meatballs.  Those are all amazingly tasty.

I just ate in the restaurant for the first time last night, and it was mostly a good experience.  There were some issues with service, however, that resulted in 4 and not 5 stars.

Ordering in the restaurant is a little odd.  You order right when you walk in and then you get a table.  OK - but I had to wait ages while the woman in front of me tasted wines, asked a million questions, etc.  Just seemed like there should be a better way to do this...  Maybe, if they have a guest like that, another person manages the rest of the line?  Or, maybe alcohol could be ordered once people sit?  

Anyway, for dinner, we had the little gem salad, the kale and cabbage salad, the pappardelle with braised pork, another pasta dish with ham and peas (not on the online menu), a side of golden beets, and a side of seasonal pickles.  Everything was fantastic, except maybe the pickles, which were kind of meh and very heavy on the bell pepper.  We also split a soft-serve gelato with a number of delicious toppings for dessert - my only complaint is that it's served in a small juice glass, so the topping to ice cream ratio is off.  Would be better in a bowl.  I also had a glass of Lieu Dit rose.  Although their alcohol offerings aren't vast, they have a very quality selection - both with respect to the sources and the diversity.  I enjoyed my glass of wine very much!

The service issue wasn't with the people - everyone was nice, service was efficient, and the food came out quickly.  It was just TOO quick.  They operate under a mentality of - we serve the food whenever it's ready...but that only works to a point.  I understand if one person's entree is ready a little faster, they get it first....but for our meal, my boyfriend got his salad and pasta simultaneously, then I got my pasta five minutes later, then I got my salad another 5 minutes after that.  Then, the beets came out probably after another five minutes.  So, we wound up with a ton of food to eat all at once, and my pasta started getting cold as I was trying to get through the salad - so I really just ended up speed-eating.  Not as relaxing as it could be.

Anyway, minus the latter issue, the food and atmosphere are awesome and I'm sure we'll be back!
author: Tay H.

description:
My friends and I described BARZOTTO as the perfect 2nd date place. It's causal and simple while maintaining elegance. The one page menu is simple: 2 salads, 5 pastas, 2 meats, 3 sides, and gelato (OMG. THE. GELATO). 

I came with two other friends and we ordered the following pastas ranked by our favorite:

1) Fazzoletti
2) Strozzapreti
3) Cresta di gallo

The pastas are a perfect lunch size; one person can finish their own bowl of pasta. 

We also ordered the "little gem" salad and chicken. I normally would never order chicken at a restaurant. Never. But the host talked so highly about it and said "if you don't like it, we'll give you the porchetta for free instead." Well, in that case we'll try the chicken and we loved it.
